data.title: We Are IT – Hao Dong - Office of Information Technology
data.snippet: Regarding machine learning, Dong collaborates with faculty on research projects to produce models and supply consulting services. From advising faculty on the most effective ML tools to use or co-developing solutions, his efforts serve to merge data science and practical applications in the academic environment. “Some of the projects come from professors, so we work together with them to develop different models,” he said. “Sometimes it’s just providing consulting services. For example, they are unsure which model to use or how to build a model, so we have discussions with them and sometimes even code together.” [...] Dong stresses the critical function OIT serves in supporting the campus, from faculty and staff to students. “OIT is supporting the whole university, and that’s quite amazing,” he said. “We have different parts to support different functions across the university.” When asked what the future of IT looked like on campus, he expressed a desire for the continued enhancement of education through new tools and research collaboration. “The priority is definitely to keep supporting the UA community,” he said. “At the same time, keeping pace with new technology is also important.” [...] Hao Dong recently joined The University of Alabama in February 2024 and has since served a crucial role in promoting ML and GIS technologies through OIT. His path to the IT field began with an interest in mathematics, a foundation that sparked a curiosity toward programming. While in graduate school, he studied engineering and planning, through which he discovered a passion for automating processes via coding. “When I had the opportunity to do some programming to either speed up the process or automate some process, I enjoyed doing it,” he explained. This interest shifted into expertise, leading Dong to his career in IT, where he now generates machine learning models and manages GIS systems.

data.title: Generative AI for Music and Audio (UC San Diego) - YouTube
data.snippet:
# Hao Wen (Herman) Dong's PhD Defense: Generative AI for Music and Audio (UC San Diego)
## Hao-Wen (Herman) Dong 董皓文

### Description
525 views
Posted: 17 May 2024
Hao-Wen (Herman) Dong's PhD Defense on "Generative AI for Music and Audio" at Department of Computer Science and Engineering, UC San Diego

Slides: 

Date: May 15, 2024 [...] think it's an ongoing debate or discussion but still there are some ways that we can potentially create a new business model or how it could like benefit both side of the uh the situations and so you know people have been looking into how it can apply to music awesome um so again uh these are my future direction that I'm interested in cool and with that uh finally I would like to uh thank many people in my PhD study so first big thank you to my advisers uh Julian and Taylor uh yeah I do remember the first meeting that I had with you so I like first year is like in D and I transferred to CSC and so yeah it was really nice that like you have me as your students and I learned a lot from the pro process and even though I did a lot of interships but still I think the flexibility that you give [...] few years uh in the burg lab and also moli lab and thank you to my family uh especially my wife who who is also defending soon next uh the week after next and it was really nice to do PhD here at UCSD together for the past five years and yeah financially thank you for supporting my pH study uh um and also various internships and also fellowships and thank you UCSD and so next chapter I will become a assistant professor at um University of Michigan in the department of Performing Art technology under the School of Music theater and dance which will be super cold in winter but yeah I might miss the sunshine here so with that thank you so much for coming today um I hope you actually see something interesting from my dog questions questions I guess oh yeah we're supposed to moderate right
